tasks.name: Select Licensing Pathway & Products
tasks.description: Decide between Part 52 (ESP/DC/COL) or Part 50 (CP/OL) strategies, including topical report plan and sequencing of submittals.
whatIsInvolved: Evaluate project risk, schedule, financing, and vendor readiness against DC/COL vs. CP/OL.
Define scope of Early Site Permit (ESP), Design Certification (DC), and Combined License (COL) as applicable.
Plan topical reports (methods, QA, HFE, PRA, fuel/TH, seismic/SSI, cyber, EP, security).
mustAccomplish: Chosen pathway with rationale and master submittal schedule.
Defined licensing products and responsibility assignment (Owner/Designer/Vendor).
acceptance: Executive approval of pathway and deliverables baseline.
Regulatory roadmap endorsed by NSRB/ISR.

subtasks.title: Regulatory Pathway Decision Analysis (Part 50 vs Part 52)
details: Define decision criteria: schedule risk, capital-at-risk, hearing exposure, construction parallelism, vendor readiness, staffing, precedent strength.
Assemble alternatives: ESP+DC+COL; DC+COL; straight COL; Part 50 CP→OL; hybrids (e.g., TR stack + COL).
Quantify schedule and cost risk via Monte Carlo (milestones: submittals, RAIs, audits, hearings, construction, ITAAC).
Quantify regulatory risk using PRA-informed insights (where applicable) and precedent analysis.
Perform multi-criteria decision analysis (MCDA) and document rationale and sensitivities.
